Dawid,

Which of these situations are you targeting?

Situation 1:

@RunWit=
h(MyCustomSuite.class)
@SuiteClasses({A.class, B.class, ...})
public class =
Suite { ... }

@Ignore
public class A { ... }

Situation 2:

@Ignore
@RunWi=
th(MyCustomRunner.class)
public class A { ... }

Thanks,

   David Saff

On=
 Wed, Apr 18, 2012 at 4:19 AM, Dawid Weiss <dawid.weiss@...> wrote:

uilder() before

unner runnerForClass(Class<?> testClass) throws Throwable {
> List<RunnerBu=
ilder> builders=3D Arrays.asList(
> ignoredBuilder(),
> annotatedBuilder(),=

> ...

> I understand this was done to enforce consistent handling of @Ig=
nore

r than just skipping the entire class).

ost likely break annotated runners that

his could be a tweak to
